item.title: 3 errors------------------
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Don’t put it in NPChandler, declare it with your other voids in Client.java

Read full topic

item.title: 3 errors------------------
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

theres the summon method

public void SummonNewNPC(int npcID, String name) {
server.npcHandler.newSummonedNPC(npcID, absX, absY-1, heightLevel, absX-1, absY-1, absX+1, absY-1, 1, server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(npcID), false, playerId);
summonedNPCS++;
actionTimer = 20;
sendMessage("You Summon a "+name);

}

And i changed sendMessage to sM which fixed one of the errors so only 2 left

EDIT: just changed action timer to actionInterval so one error left

Read full topic

item.title: 3 errors------------------
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

You don’t have an ‘actiontimer’ variable, sendMessage() method, or newSummonedNPC() method. My guess is that the method’s arguments are different than how you are invoking it.

Read full topic

item.title: 3 errors------------------
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Absolutely no clue about that one, but I know you need to declare something but I’m not sure what.
You need to declare the actual actionTimer variable to use it.
sendMessage is not recognized, use sM.

Read full topic

summonedNPCS++;
